hours_text:
We hope to welcome you soon to the museum!

## General Information

Staff at the front desk can provide helpful information for your visit. Please stop in whenever you like.

Find answers to your questions and guidelines for your visit: [**Know Before You Go**](https://kam.illinois.edu/know-before-you-go)

Krannert Art Museum is located at the corner of Sixth Street and Peabody Drive on campus at the University of Illinois Urbana-Champaign.

### Hours

Tuesday–Friday 10 am–5 pm  
Saturday 10 am–4 pm  
Thursday until 8 pm, when classes are in session

### Holiday Closures

The museum is closed each year for the following holidays: Martin Luther King, Jr. Day, Memorial Day, Juneteenth, Independence Day, Labor Day, Thanksgiving Holiday (Thursday, Friday, and Saturday).

In addition, the museum closes for a Winter Holiday, typically Dec 24 through Jan 1, during University of Illinois Reduced Service Days.

### Free Admission 

Krannert Art Museum is always free and open to the public.

This is made possible by the generosity of our donors. If you'd like to support the museum, please [contribute to the museum online](https://www.givecampus.com/campaigns/49568/donations/new?designation_id=11332155) or using a donation box at the entrance. 

To support the museum on an ongoing basis, please [visit our Annual Memberships page](https://kam.illinois.edu/membership) to learn how to become a Friend of Krannert Art Museum.

## Address and Directions

Krannert Art Museum   
500 East Peabod...

accessibility_text:
Fletcher Benton, China Moon II (detail), 1998. From Steel Watercolor series. Steel. Gift of Albert Broday, Joseph M. Schwartz, Allan R. Steinberg, and Robert Broday. 2000-12-1 

Krannert Art Museum endeavors to be accessible to visitors of all ages and abilities. We value open access to galleries. Visitors do not need to disclose a disability in order to access assistance.

For assistance, send an email to [kam-accessibility@illinois.edu](mailto:kam-accessibility@illinois.edu?subject=Accessibility%20question) or call 217-333-1861 to leave a message.

## 

## Accessible Parking

Accessible parking is available in the museum lot at the corner of Peabody Drive and Sixth Street (Lot E19) and in the small lot to the north of the School of Art & Design building (Lot E18). There is one designated spot in each lot.

To use designated spaces, cars must display a valid state disability placard or plate. 

All parking in Lot E19 is metered Monday–Friday, from 6 am–5 pm; there is one space designated for disabled permit parking in that lot. There is also an accessible metered space in E18, near the ramp. Campus meters may be paid by phone or via the MobileMeter app. Please see on-meter signage for payment instructions. If you need any help, ask a staff member when you enter the building. During open hours, you can reach staff in the lobby at 217-244-0745.

To access the Gelvin Garden, use the ramp at the west side of Lot E19.

Encounters: The Arts of Africa, installation at Krannert Art Museum, 2016. Photo by L. Brian Stauffer

Krannert Art Museum serves the campus of the University of Illinois Urbana-Champaign and the communities of East Central Illinois. Everyone is welcome to enjoy the museum’s rich collection of fine art from across the globe, vibrant exhibitions, and engaging events and initiatives. 

[Exhibitions](/exhibitions-events/exhibitions)

[ Jan 6, 2026 to Mar 21, 2026 Latina Voces: Student Art Exhibition ](/exhibition/latina-voces-student-art-exhibition)
